System Designer will search for a running application in the same domain.

If System Designer finds one, it will import its system and you will be able to update its models, components and behaviors.

documentation-overview.html.source:
What is System Designer ?

Design is the base of every app.

System Designer will help you to create JavaScript Application Systems, applications driven by the design.

Features:

  • No file-system: focus on your business logic and not on the structure of your project. Your entire project is stored in a NoSQL DB and it can be exported in a single JSON object.
  • Hot-reload: Updating your application in System Designer will automatically update your connected app. You do not need to reload your app to see your latests modifications.
  • Remote designing: get the model, behaviors and components of all running apps and update them live..
  • Module builder: your HTML or CSS can be required in your app.

System Designer is part of the System SDK project.

What is System SDK ?

System SDK project is a SDK for building JavaScript Application Systems. It contains:

  • System Designer, a UI designer to create JavaScript Application Systems and
  • Runtime, a JavaScript library to run and manage JavaScript Application Systems.

System SDK Architecture

  • System Designer is build upon Runtime,
  • System Designer can create and import/export systems (as JSON file),
  • Runtime can import and export systems,
  • Runtime can create an application from a system,
  • Runtime can generate a system from an application.
  1. Documentation
  2. Overview

documentation-quick-start.html.source:
In this quick start, we will:

  • create a system,
  • run it client side
  • and server side.

Create a system

  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • set StarWars as name,
  • a new system is now created and appears in the Systems list.

Create a schema

  • click on the Schema tab,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • set Jedi as name,
  • a new schema is now created and appears in the Schemas list,
  • click on it,
  • update the MSON with this:
{
   "_name": "Jedi",
   "_inherit": [
     "RuntimeComponent"
   ],
   "firstName": "property",
   "lastName": "property",
   "father": "link",
   "fullName": "method"
 }
  • save.

note:

Use property for creating a property.
Use link for creating a link between models.
Use collection for creating a collection.
Use method for creating a method.
Use event for creating an event.

Create a model

  • click on the Models tab,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • set Jedi as name and select Jedi as schema,,
  • a new model is now created and appears in the Models list.

The model is generated with the informations you set in the schema.
You can edit these informations by editing the model.

Create a behavior

  • click on the Behaviors tab,
  • select Jedi on right,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • select fullName,
  • a new behavior is now created and appears in the Behaviors list,
  • click on it,
  • update the code with this:
function fullName(param) {
   var result = this.firstName() + ' ' + this.lastName();
   return result;
 }
  • save.

Create components

  • click on the Components tab,
  • select Jedi on right,
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • a new component is now created and appears in the Components list,
  • click on it,
  • update the JSON with this:
{
   "_id": "13331191e31d2d0",
   "father": {},
   "firstName": "Dark",
   "lastName": "Vador"
 }
  • save.
  • click on the + button on the left toolbar,
  • a new component is now created and appears in the Components list,
  • click on it,
  • update the JSON with this:
{
   "_id": "166c21e4a01dd30",
   "father": "13331191e31d2d0",
   "firstName": "Luke",
   "lastName": "Skywalker"
 }
  • save.

Add code on the main method of the system

  • click on the Behaviors tab,
  • click on StarWars on the right list,
  • click on the element who has got 'main' as name,
  • update the code with this:
function main() {
     var luke = null;
 
     // get the component
     luke = this.require('166c21e4a01dd30');
 
     // get the name of the father of Luke
     console.log(luke.father().fullName());
 }
  • save.

Test the system

  • click on the run button on the left of toolbar,
  • open the console of the browser and you will see the result.

Run your system client side

  • click on the export button,
  • select HTML,
  • your system will be exported in a HTML file,
  • load the page.

Run your system server side

  • click on the export button,
  • select JS (node),
  • your system will be exported in a JavaScript file,
  • save the file on your server project,
  • in your project, install this package to run your system:
npm install system-runtime --save
  • run your system:
node StarWars.js
  1. Documentation
  2. Quick Start

export-app.html.source: <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head>     <title>{{name}}</title>     <meta charset="UTF-8">     <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> </head> <body>     <!-- Runtime -->     <script>     {{library}}     </script>     <!-- System -->     <script>     runtime.on('ready', function () {         var systemId = runtime.require('db').system({{system}});          var system = runtime.require(systemId);         system.main();     });     </script> </body> </html>

help-behaviors.html.source: A behavior is a method that will be called when a class state has changed.

help-components.html.source: A component is the store of an instance of the model.

help-models.html.source: A model is an UML representation of your classes. When you create a model, you generate it from a schema. A model will be then created with the default values. You can edit them after.

help-schemas.html.source: A schema is the definition of your model. Models are generated based on the schema definition.

help-system.html.source: An application is a system. Once you have defined it, your next step is to create a schema.

help-types.html.source: A type is used in your model to define an enumeration or a structure.
